author: Nicole J De Marco
text:
Fraudulent Company! I will have to join the chore of bad reviews and people who would give it 0 if they could. 

I have received a few present from VC in the past, not being me who bought it and having received pieces I really wanted I decided to join as a seller in order to re-sell some of my loved items. I sold my first Mulberry bag and packed it carefully with the right labelling. The client was based not far off from London so the chosen courier was Hermes. A few days after sending the parcel I receive a message from the buyer who informs me she received a pair of £29,99 Zara trousers instead of the £160 Mulberry bag. 
The client shared a picture of the parcel and I luckily also took some before sending the box. The two picture did not match! Proving then that the parcel has been tampered and that the bag has been stolen by someone (Hermes? VC? Who knows!)

Fastforward 5 days of chasing VC over the live chat, explaining the happening to every single agent and with the promise that 'someone will email you' or 'rest reassured we are taking care of it' and 'we apologise for any inconvenience' I still have no news of what happened to the bag I carefully packed or about a compensation for losing my item. 

After reading countless complaints here and on other platforms, it seems obvious to me that VC with a facade of sustainable luxury fashion re-seller is in reality a dishonest company that makes money on the shoulders of those who naively believe they found a bargain, not to mention the lack of professional structured customer service dedicated to the resolution of issues with orders, payments, listings etc.

If you really are looking for a high end luxury pre-owned item you better off on Ebay or Marketplace.

STAY AWAY FROM VESTAIRE COLLECTIVE!
title: Fraudulent Company

author: JS
text:
Vestiaire's feedback was incorrect: it took a total of 22 emails to get the description changed. Each time they said in the chat that it was changed, it wasn't, and I finally had to tell them the exact wording in the email. Pathetic ineptitude - and weasely response from them below, as always.


Velvet Jacket, Ref. 19047137

As the seller, I was surprised to see that someone at Vestiaire had changed the description of my jacket without consulting me. In my first contact, approx 4 November with Angela, I was assured the changes had been made. Two further contacts were made, apologies were followed by assurances the changes would be made.

I've just checked and, having three times given the same instructions to change the description back to what I originally wrote, it's still unchanged. 

It still reads 'not just for dressing up' instead of 'not just for fancy dress parties'.

It still reads designers instead of designer's in the second paragraph. 

The third paragraph - clearly someone's invention - is still there when it's obvious it shouldn't be.

Every time I've been assured the changes had been made and would be visible in 24 to 72 hours. 

They haven't been. My first complaint was approx 4 November, it's now 21 November; I've wasted a huge amount of time interacting with Vestiaire customer service, always receiving the apology for the inconvenience and always, ultimately, with nothing changing. Pathetic way to treat customers.
title: Incompetent Time Wasters

author: mary m

author: Hannah
text: I purchased a pair of Chanel Mules ref 18895937. Once I opened them I was unsure about the authenticity, knowing the quality of Chanel I was concerned when I noticed stitching coming undone, visible glue and no serial number. I arranged an independent company to authenticate them for my piece of mind (even though I paid Vestiaire to authenticate!) and of course they found them to be counterfeit. I wrote to Vestiaire Collective within 72 hours, via their help centre online form, explaining my situation and asking for the return process. If Vestiaire don’t support the selling of unauthentic items then why aren’t they responding to me? I feel like I have been robbed. Vestiaire what is your return process? Fancy selling fake items and then not responding to their customers. I will be taking this further and expect a response from Vestiaire and this mistake of their own to be sorted out.
title: No response from them when things go wrong

author: Elise Augarde
text:
Another terrible experience with Vestiaire Collective. I sold an item with VC and it took 1 month and a half and easily 20+ emails from me to get the item delivered just the other side of town. I would have been much faster bringing the item walking...
Despite their automated answers saying I would hear back from them in 24/72h, I wouldn't and had to constantly chase them. Whilst 1 lady of customer service was great (Anna) I was quickly moved to really incompetent ones who would refuse to look into my case without me sending a copy of my ID. When I asked what for, I never got a clear answer!! Eventually a colleague took over and moved on with the case, no need for my ID! This is so erratic and incompetent!
Now that the item has been delivered and approved, I was relieved that this would be all over soon. But NO, I am STILL waiting for payment 9 days after delivery!!!

author: MaryC
text:
The costumer service is alright and responded to my email with considerable amount of time, there are genuine sellers and not so updated sellers.
I will give 1 star for this was my first purchase on their app and it didn’t make me happy and feel safe to shop. 
Both my items was refunded but the money didnt come backnin my account within supposed business days. 72 hrs(?) is it?
First item has been shipped by the seller but Vestiaire somehow cancelled it and the seller doesnt know why they did it. Im waiting the refund that I felt will never comeback.
2nd item, the seller seems to be online on her account and confirmed that the item is available, took 2 weeks but didnt ship it. I messaged the seller but didn’t even reply. As soon as I message, few hours later, the item was now unavailable and now Vestiaire have to give me the refund. The seller didnt even apologised to me for not communicating and checking on her selling item when she was actually online few times when I look at her profile.
Im furious because this is my hard working money spent here. I’m eager to pay the seller who actually committed and communicate with me personally via her own number. I might as well pay her directly on her account and not through the site.
You guys need to update your quality of service. My first experience is bad. It will take awhile to convince me to buy another item.
Good luck to anyone who use this site.

author: kathleen fong
text:
The worse experience selling an item online. 

After being told that my item was successful recieved and that I will be getting my payment in 5 days- I patiently waited for 2 weeks before sending out my first email to the customer service team. I requested some details of the payment so that I can check with my bank, and while they’ll provide the invoice number they kept masking the bank account it was sent to (only leaving the last 4 numbers). Firstly, It’s my bank account, why must you mask it? And despite only providing 4 numbers, they got the number order wrong! I even sent a screenshot comparing what i provided to them on the app and what their invoice showed. 

At this point it was 1 month of back and forth and when I brought up the payment being made to a wrong account- but all i got from their agent Renz was that “this is a exception.. will reply you in 3 day..” 

Absolutely frustrating - its a straightforward case of contacting the bank to make a report and paying me for what you already earned commission for! shady af and judging from how other sellers didnt get their payment, it screams scam

Edit: The team has fulfilled and transferring the payment owed in full. Though it was a long process and a ton of chasing on my end- there was a resolution and they had proven to stay accountability and not a scam business.
title: the worse seller experience

text:

I'm just really upset because every time I order this happens now.


On the plus side the new commission fee for VC is much better .

author: jasmine
text: This is the first time I purchased from Vestiaire and I won’t ever purchase again. I ordered an item and immediately after purchasing realised that I had set up a klarna payment plan using the incorrect card . Meaning I would not be able to make the payments . I contacted them on chat within 10 mins to request to cancel the order and was told only the seller could do this . I then contacted the seller and they were happy to cancel it but said they weren’t able to as Vestiaire has already booked in for DHL to collect the item. I used the chat feature multiple times to speak to someone from customer service to explain they needed to cancel it on their end because the seller was unable to and that I had a large amount of money pending from my account i needed to be cancelled immediately. At the point I was so appalled by the customer service there was no way that I wanted to purchase anything via them so wished to completely cancel the order and did not want the item at all. i was told that they don’t cancel orders unless the item is no longer available which is completely against the Consumer Contracts Regulations in which I had a  right to cancel an order from the moment i placed it and for another 14 days that had passed from the day. As the item had not even been collected and was still with the seller there should of been no issue for them to just cancel the order for me but they made it literally impossible to the point I had to contact my bank to ask them to stop the payment from going through. After multiple chats with customer service and emails from myself and the seller the sale finally was cancelled but I will never trust this company with my money again
